title: examples of the input files to the train process without AQUAS
body:
Hi,

Are there examples of what the input files to the training process should look like if they haven't been produced by the AQUAS pipeline? E.g. starting from a file like file1_dedup.bam file, what are the peaks and signal tracks files that are needed, and how are they produced by MACS2?

Thanks.

title: A parameter in the file getSignalTrack.sh
body: Hello, I find your bash script getSignalTrack.sh (Line 15)  there is a parameter -tag2bw  but I searched your chip-seq pipeline and only found out a commented line in chipseq.bds(https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline/blob/fe55069187d7a7a55c75ce33b8517b47be14f3ae/chipseq.bds)   So I was wondered whether this bash file will still worked? Thanks~

title: A file name glitch in copyData.py
body:
In copyData.py, the last line `call('mv *gappedPeaks* %s' % di.PEAK_GAPPED_DIR, shell=True)` move the downloaded temperary files to the PEAK_GAPPED_DIR directory.
However all the gapped peak files extracted from `low_seq_depth_processed_files.tar.gz` contain no 's' on their file name. 
Changing that line to `call('mv *gappedPeak* %s' % di.PEAK_GAPPED_DIR, shell=True)` seems to fix the issue. Is this only happen to me?
